trans-unit.source: Epson ESC/POS with formatting
trans-unit.target: Epson ESC/POS with formatting

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: PointofService Printer
trans-unit.target: PointofService Printer

trans-unit.source: Windows.Devices.PointOfService
trans-unit.target: Windows.Devices.PointOfService

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the ESC/POS command language to format text, such as bold and double size characters, for your Point of Service printer.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the ESC/POS command language to format text, such as bold and double size characters, for your Point of Service printer.

trans-unit.source: ESC/POS usage
trans-unit.target: ESC/POS usage

trans-unit.source: Windows Point of Service provides use of a variety of printers, including several Epson TM series printers (for a full list of supported printers, see the [PointofService Printer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt426652) page).
trans-unit.target: Windows Point of Service provides use of a variety of printers, including several Epson TM series printers (for a full list of supported printers, see the [PointofService Printer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt426652) page).

trans-unit.source: Windows supports printing through the ESC/POS printer control language, which provides efficient and functional commands for communicating with your printer.
trans-unit.target: Windows supports printing through the ESC/POS printer control language, which provides efficient and functional commands for communicating with your printer.

trans-unit.source: ESC/POS is a command system created by Epson used across a wide range of POS printer systems, aimed at avoiding incompatible command sets by providing universal applicability.
trans-unit.target: ESC/POS is a command system created by Epson used across a wide range of POS printer systems, aimed at avoiding incompatible command sets by providing universal applicability.

trans-unit.source: Most modern printers support ESC/POS.
trans-unit.target: Most modern printers support ESC/POS.

trans-unit.source: All commands start with the ESC character (ASCII 27, HEX 1B) or GS (ASCII 29, HEX 1D), followed by another character that specifies the command.
trans-unit.target: All commands start with the ESC character (ASCII 27, HEX 1B) or GS (ASCII 29, HEX 1D), followed by another character that specifies the command.

trans-unit.source: Normal text is simply sent to the printer, separated by line breaks.
trans-unit.target: Normal text is simply sent to the printer, separated by line breaks.

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows PointOfService API**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn298071) provides much of that functionality for you via the **Print()** or **PrintLine()** methods.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows PointOfService API**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn298071) provides much of that functionality for you via the **Print()** or **PrintLine()** methods.

trans-unit.source: However, to get certain formatting or to send specific commands, you must use ESC/POS commands, built as a string and sent to the printer.
trans-unit.target: However, to get certain formatting or to send specific commands, you must use ESC/POS commands, built as a string and sent to the printer.

trans-unit.source: Example using bold and double size characters
trans-unit.target: Example using bold and double size characters

trans-unit.source: The example below shows how to use ESC/POS commands to print in bold and double sized characters.
trans-unit.target: The example below shows how to use ESC/POS commands to print in bold and double sized characters.

trans-unit.source: Note that each command is built as a string, then inserted into the printJob calls.
trans-unit.target: Note that each command is built as a string, then inserted into the printJob calls.

trans-unit.source: For more information on ESC/POS, including available commands, check out the [Epson ESC/POS FAQ](http://content.epson.de/fileadmin/content/files/RSD/downloads/escpos.pdf).
trans-unit.target: For more information on ESC/POS, including available commands, check out the [Epson ESC/POS FAQ](http://content.epson.de/fileadmin/content/files/RSD/downloads/escpos.pdf).

trans-unit.source: For details on [**Windows.Devices.PointOfService**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn298071) and all the available functionality, see [PointofService Printer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt426652) on MSDN.
trans-unit.target: For details on [**Windows.Devices.PointOfService**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn298071) and all the available functionality, see [PointofService Printer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt426652) on MSDN.
